intro: Erodium pachyrhizum, commonly known as the broadroot commonwealth, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers. The plant has a deep, fleshy root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Erodium pachyrhizum is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and inland regions.
